Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Procyon \Pro"cy*on\, n. [L., a constellation which rises before the Dog Star, Gr. ?; ? before + ? a dog. ] [1913 Webster] 1. (Astron.) A star of the first magnitude in the constellation Canis Minor, or the Little Dog. [1913 Webster]
2. (Zo["o]l.) A genus of mammals including the raccoon. [1913 Webster]
Procyon n 1: the brightest star in Canis Minor 2: the type genus of the family Procyonidae: raccoons [syn: {genus Procyon}]
